taskTree.name: OnSolve Integration - SQL Database - Process Incoming Data

taskDefinition.name: OnSolve Integration - SQL Database - Process Incoming Data

parameter.label: Source Data
parameter.tooltip: A JSON object of the ServiceNow ticket details

parameter.label: Integration Config Id
parameter.tooltip: The Submission Id of the Integration Config datastore submission

parameter.label: Integration Config Values
parameter.tooltip: A JSON object of the integration configuration values

parameter.label: Error Handling
parameter.tooltip: Determine what to return if an error is encountered.

parameter.label: Space Slug
parameter.tooltip: The Space the submission is being retrieved from (defaults to info value if not provided).

parameter.label: Kapp Slug
parameter.tooltip: The slug of the Kapp to search for submissions in.

parameter.label: Form Slug
parameter.tooltip: The slug of the Form to search for submissions in.

parameter.label: Query
parameter.tooltip: The query that will be used to search the submissions. Ex: values[company]=Kinetic

parameters.parameter:
<%= details = JSON.parse( @inputs['Source Data'] ) integration_config = JSON.parse( @inputs['Integration Config Values'] ) #source_id_value = details[integration_config['Internal Unique Key Field Name']]['value'] || details[integration_config['Internal Unique Key Field Name']] source_id_value = begin details[integration_config['Internal Unique Key Field Name']]['value'] || details[integration_config['Internal Unique Key Field Name']] rescue details[integration_config['Internal Unique Key Field Name']] end
query_addendum = "" if integration_config['Notify more than once per record'] == "Yes" query_addendum = %|AND values[Onsolve Status] IN ("Pending","Open")| end
query = %|include=details,values&q=values[Integration Id]="#{@inputs['Integration Config Id']}" AND values[Source Id]="#{source_id_value}"| + query_addendum
query%>

parameter.label: Page Token
parameter.tooltip: The value to use as the offset for the page of submissions to return. The submission that matches this value will not be included in the results.

parameter.label: Return Type
parameter.tooltip: The format that the results should be returned in.

task.label: Any - Non Unique
Any - Unique

parameter.label: Error Handling
parameter.tooltip: Determine what to return if an error is encountered.

parameter.label: Space Slug
parameter.tooltip: The Space the submission is being retrieved from (defaults to info value if not provided).

parameter.label: Kapp Slug
parameter.tooltip: The slug of the Kapp the submission is for.

parameter.label: Form Slug
parameter.tooltip: The slug of the form the submission is for.

parameter.label: Values
parameter.tooltip: JSON map of submission field values.

parameters.parameter:
<%= integration_details = JSON.parse( @inputs['Integration Config Values'] ) details = JSON.parse( @inputs['Source Data'] ) response_expected = "Yes" if integration_details['Interim Update Action'] == "None" && integration_details['Notification Result Action'] == "None" response_expected = "No" end #source_id = details[integration_details['Internal Unique Key Field Name']]['value'] || details[integration_details['Internal Unique Key Field Name']] #source_ref_id = details[integration_details['External Unique Key Field Name']]['value'] || details[integration_details['External Unique Key Field Name']] source_id = begin details[integration_details['Internal Unique Key Field Name']]['value'] || details[integration_details['Internal Unique Key Field Name']] rescue details[integration_details['Internal Unique Key Field Name']] end source_ref_id = begin details[integration_details['External Unique Key Field Name']]['value'] || details[integration_details['External Unique Key Field Name']] rescue details[integration_details['External Unique Key Field Name']] end
{ "Integration Name" => integration_details['Name'], "Integration Id" => @inputs['Integration Config Id'], "Response Expected" => response_expected, "Message" => "Database Record: #{source_ref_id}", "Source Id" => source_id, "Source Reference Id" => source_ref_id, "Onsolve Status" => "Pending", "Source Data" => details }.to_json%>

parameter.label: Current Page Name
parameter.tooltip: Set the current page name.

parameter.label: Current Page Navigation
parameter.tooltip: Set the current page navigation.

parameter.label: Origin ID
parameter.tooltip: Set the origin ID.

parameter.label: Parent ID
parameter.tooltip: Set the parent ID.

parameter.label: Error Handling
parameter.tooltip: Determine what to return if an error is encountered.

parameter.label: Space Slug
parameter.tooltip: The Space the submission is being retrieved from (defaults to info value if not provided).

parameter.label: Submission Id
parameter.tooltip: The id of the submission being updated.

parameter.label: State
parameter.tooltip: The value used to set the submission state.

parameter.label: Values
parameter.tooltip: A JSON map of field names to values that should be set.

parameter.label: Current Page Name
parameter.tooltip: Set the current page name.

parameter.label: Current Page Navigation
parameter.tooltip: Set the current page navigation.

parameter.label: Origin ID
parameter.tooltip: Set the origin ID.

parameter.label: Parent ID
parameter.tooltip: Set the parent ID.

parameters.parameter:
<%=
def organize(operator, obj) wrapper_array = [] clause_array = [] operator_value = "||" if operator == "OR" operator_value = "&&" if operator == "AND" obj.each{ |k, v| if v.is_a? Hash clause_array.push( organize(k, v) ) else clause_array.push( evaluate(k, v ) ) end } wrapper_array.push( "(" ) # Intersperse clause array with operator and add to wrapper_array wrapper_array.push( clause_array.flat_map { |x| [x, operator_value] }[0...-1] ) wrapper_array.push( ")" )
return wrapper_array.flatten end
def evaluate(field_input, check) # determine which part of the field to retrieve - the display_value or the field_value field_qualifier = 'value' field = field_input field_array = field_input.split(".") if field_array.length > 0 if ["display_value","value"].include? field_array[1] field_qualifier = field_array[1] end field = field_array[0] end
existing_activity_record = JSON.parse( @results['Active Alerts']['Result'] ) old_data = JSON.parse( existing_activity_record[0]['values']['Source Data'] ) new_data = JSON.parse( @inputs['Source Data'] )
# Be able to handle if the data uses field qualifiers or not new_field_value = new_data[field][field_qualifier] || new_data[field] old_field_value = old_data[field][field_qualifier] || old_data[field]
evaluation_result = false case check when "{{Different}}" evaluation_result = true if new_field_value != old_field_value when "{{Different Not Empty}}" evaluation_result = true if new_field_value != old_field_value && !new_field_value.to_s.empty? when "{{Empty}}" evaluation_result = true if new_field_value.to_s.empty? when "{{Not Empty}}" evaluation_result = true if !new_field_value.to_s.empty? else #evaluation_result = true if new_field_value == check evaluation_result = true if check.split("||").include?(new_field_value) end return evaluation_result end
def determine(criteria) array=[] a = JSON.parse(criteria) a.each{ |k, v| if v.is_a? Hash array.push( organize(k, v) ) else array.push( evaluate(k, v) ) end } result = eval(array.join) return result end
restart_criteria = JSON.parse( @inputs['Integration Config Values'] )['Restart Notification Criteria']
restart_result = determine(restart_criteria)
restart_result %>

parameters.parameter:
<%= integration_details = JSON.parse( @inputs['Integration Config Values'] ) details = JSON.parse( @inputs['Source Data'] ) response_expected = "Yes" if integration_details['Interim Update Action'] == "None" && integration_details['Notification Result Action'] == "None" response_expected = "No" end #source_id = details[integration_details['Internal Unique Key Field Name']]['value'] || details[integration_details['Internal Unique Key Field Name']] #source_ref_id = details[integration_details['External Unique Key Field Name']]['value'] || details[integration_details['External Unique Key Field Name']] source_id = begin details[integration_details['Internal Unique Key Field Name']]['value'] || details[integration_details['Internal Unique Key Field Name']] rescue details[integration_details['Internal Unique Key Field Name']] end source_ref_id = begin details[integration_details['External Unique Key Field Name']]['value'] || details[integration_details['External Unique Key Field Name']] rescue details[integration_details['External Unique Key Field Name']] end
{ "Integration Name" => integration_details['Name'], "Integration Id" => @inputs['Integration Config Id'], "Response Expected" => response_expected, "Message" => "Database Record: #{source_ref_id}", "Source Id" => source_id, "Source Reference Id" => source_ref_id, "Onsolve Status" => "Pending", "Source Data" => details }.to_json%>

parameters.parameter:
<%=
def organize(operator, obj) wrapper_array = [] clause_array = [] operator_value = "||" if operator == "OR" operator_value = "&&" if operator == "AND" obj.each{ |k, v| if v.is_a? Hash clause_array.push( organize(k, v) ) else clause_array.push( evaluate(k, v ) ) end } wrapper_array.push( "(" ) # Intersperse clause array with operator and add to wrapper_array wrapper_array.push( clause_array.flat_map { |x| [x, operator_value] }[0...-1] ) wrapper_array.push( ")" )
return wrapper_array.flatten end
def evaluate(field_input, check) # determine which part of the field to retrieve - the display_value or the field_value field_qualifier = 'value' field = field_input field_array = field_input.split(".") if field_array.length > 0 if ["display_value","value"].include? field_array[1] field_qualifier = field_array[1] end field = field_array[0] end
existing_activity_record = JSON.parse( @results['Active Alerts']['Result'] ) old_data = JSON.parse( existing_activity_record[0]['values']['Source Data'] ) new_data = JSON.parse( @inputs['Source Data'] )
# Be able to handle if the data uses field qualifiers or not new_field_value = new_data[field][field_qualifier] || new_data[field] old_field_value = old_data[field][field_qualifier] || old_data[field]
evaluation_result = false case check when "{{Different}}" evaluation_result = true if new_field_value != old_field_value when "{{Different Not Empty}}" evaluation_result = true if new_field_value != old_field_value && !new_field_value.to_s.empty? when "{{Empty}}" evaluation_result = true if new_field_value.to_s.empty? when "{{Not Empty}}" evaluation_result = true if !new_field_value.to_s.empty? else #evaluation_result = true if new_field_value == check evaluation_result = true if check.split("||").include?(new_field_value) end return evaluation_result end
def determine(criteria) array=[] a = JSON.parse(criteria) a.each{ |k, v| if v.is_a? Hash array.push( organize(k, v) ) else array.push( evaluate(k, v) ) end } result = eval(array.join) return result end
stop_criteria = JSON.parse( @inputs['Integration Config Values'] )['Stop Notification Criteria'] restart_criteria = JSON.parse( @inputs['Integration Config Values'] )['Restart Notification Criteria']
stop_result = determine(stop_criteria)
# This checks the restart_criteria in case there is a competing stop / restart rule. # Restart will always take precedence. if !restart_criteria.nil? restart_result = determine(restart_criteria)
# Since the restart process already does a stop, we don't want to do another one or # there could be two completes of a defer node in down stream processes. # So we set the stop_result to false and let the restart process do the stop. stop_result = false if restart_result
end
stop_result %>
